question: I just received a notice from Virginia's Insurance Marketplace that says I am potentially eligible for Medicaid (Medical Assistance). Does that mean I have to go complete another application through CoverVA to get Medical Assistance?
text:
I just received a notice from Virginia's Insurance Marketplace that says I am potentially eligible for Medicaid (Medical Assistance). Does that mean I have to go complete another application through CoverVA to get Medical Assistance?
          
        
Thats where Virginia's Insurance Marketplace makes it easy! Virginia's Insurance Marketplace applicants who receive a notice that they are potentially eligible for Medicaid (called Medical Assistance in VA) do
NOT
need to submit another application through CoverVA. Their initial application submitted through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace will be transferred to the Department of Medical Assistance Services for a Medical Assistance eligibility determination. The local County Assistance Office will review their application and may request additional verification from the individual if necessary to make a final eligibility determination.
If you have questions about the CoverVA screening process or Medicaid (Medical Assistance) in general, you can call the Statewide Customer Service Center at
833-5CALLVA
to get more information.
A Virginia Insurance Marketplace Customer Service Representative can help with guidance and direction as well as application support by calling 1-888-687-1501. You can also find local help available in your area on
www.marketplace.virginia.gov
.
